member.name: T:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid
member.summary: A UniformGrid implementation for Silverlight that arranges children in a grid with all equal cell sizes.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of UniformGrid.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.OnIntegerDependencyPropertyChanged(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Validate the new property value and silently revert if the new value is not appropriate. Used in place of WPF value coercian by the dependency properties in UniformGrid.
member.param: The dependency object.
The dependency property.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Compute the desired size of the UniformGrid by measuring all of the children with a constraint equal to a cell's portion of the given constraint. The maximum child width and maximum child height are tracked, and then the desired size is computed by multiplying these maximums by the row and column count.
member.param: The size constraint.
member.returns: Returns the desired size.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.ArrangeOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Arrange the children of the UniformGrid by distributing space evenly among the children, making each child the size equal to a cell portion of the arrangeSize parameter.
member.param: The arrange size.
member.returns: Returns the updated Size.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.UpdateComputedValues
member.summary: If the Rows or Columns values are set to 0, dynamically compute the values based on the actual number of non-collapsed children.
member.remarks: In the case when both Rows and Columns are set to 0, the Rows and Columns will be equal, laying out a square grid.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.ComputedRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed row value.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.ComputedColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed column value.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of first columns to leave blank.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid. A value of zero indicates that the count should be dynamically computed based on the number of rows and the number of non-collapsed children in the grid.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the grid. A value of zero indicates that the row count should be dynamically computed based on the number of columns and the number of non-collapsed children in the grid.

member.name: F:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.PersianEra
member.remarks: The Persian calendar recognizes one era: A.P. (Latin "Anno Persarum", which means "the year of/for Persians").

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.AddMonths(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a DateTime that is the specified number of months away from the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to add.
The number of months to add.
member.returns: The DateTime that results from adding the specified number of months to the specified DateTime.
member.remarks:
The year part of the resulting DateTime is affected if the resulting month is beyond the last month of the current year. The day part of the resulting DateTime is also affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year; it is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. The time-of-day part of the resulting DateTime remains the same as the specified DateTime.
For example, if the specified month is Ordibehesht, which is the 2nd month and has 31 days, the specified day is the 31th day of that month, and the value of the months parameter is -3, the resulting year is one less than the specified year, the resulting month is Bahman, and the resulting day is the 30th day, which is the last day in Bahman.
If the value of the months parameter is negative, the resulting DateTime would be earlier than the specified DateTime.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.AddYears(System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a DateTime that is the specified number of years away from the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to add.
The number of years to add.
member.returns: The DateTime that results from adding the specified number of years to the specified DateTime.
member.remarks:
The day part of the resulting DateTime is affected if the resulting day is not a valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year; it is changed to the last valid day in the resulting month of the resulting year. The time-of-day part of the resulting DateTime remains the same as the specified DateTime.
For example, Esfand has 29 days, except during leap years when it has 30 days. If the specified date is the 30th day of Esfand in a leap year and the value of years is 1, the resulting date will be the 29th day of Esfand in the following year.
If years is negative, the resulting DateTime would be earlier than the specified DateTime.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetDayOfMonth(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the day of the month in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: An integer from 1 to 31 that represents the day of the month in time.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetDayOfWeek(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the day of the week in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: A DayOfWeek value that represents the day of the week in time.
member.remarks: The DayOfWeek values are Sunday which indicates YekShanbe', Monday which indicates DoShanbe', Tuesday which indicates SeShanbe', Wednesday which indicates ChaharShanbe', Thursday which indicates PanjShanbe', Friday which indicates Jom'e, and Saturday which indicates Shanbe'.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetDayOfYear(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the day of the year in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: An integer from 1 to 366 that represents the day of the year in time.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetDaysInMonth(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of days in the specified month.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the month.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: The number of days in the specified month in the specified year in the specified era.
member.remarks: For example, this method might return 29 or 30 for Esfand (month = 12), depending on whether year is a leap year.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetDaysInYear(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of days in the year specified by the year and era parameters.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: The number of days in the specified year in the specified era.
member.remarks: For example, this method might return 365 or 366, depending on whether year is a leap year.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetEra(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the era in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: An integer that represents the era in time.
member.remarks: The Persian calendar recognizes one era: A.P. (Latin "Anno Persarum", which means "the year of/for Persians").

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetMonth(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the month in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: An integer between 1 and 12 that represents the month in time.
member.remarks: Month 1 indicates Farvardin, month 2 indicates Ordibehesht, month 3 indicates Khordad, month 4 indicates Tir, month 5 indicates Amordad, month 6 indicates Shahrivar, month 7 indicates Mehr, month 8 indicates Aban, month 9 indicates Azar, month 10 indicates Dey, month 11 indicates Bahman, and month 12 indicates Esfand.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetMonthsInYear(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of months in the year specified by the year and era parameters.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: The number of months in the specified year in the specified era.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetYear(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the year in the specified DateTime.
member.param: The DateTime instance to read.
member.returns: An integer between 1 and 9378 that represents the year in time.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.IsLeapDay(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the date specified by the year, month, day, and era parameters is a leap day.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the month.
An integer that represents the day.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: true if the specified day is a leap day; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
In the Persian calendar leap years are applied every 4 or 5 years according to a certain pattern that iterates in a 2820-year cycle. A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days.
A leap day is a day that occurs only in a leap year. In the Persian calendar, the 30th day of Esfand (month 12) is the only leap day.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.IsLeapMonth(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the month specified by the year, month, and era parameters is a leap month.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the month.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: This method always returns false, unless overridden by a derived class.
member.remarks:
In the Persian calendar leap years are applied every 4 or 5 years according to a certain pattern that iterates in a 2820-year cycle. A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days.
A leap month is an entire month that occurs only in a leap year. The Persian calendar does not have any leap months.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.IsLeapYear(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the year specified by the year and era parameters is a leap year.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: true if the specified year is a leap year; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: In the Persian calendar leap years are applied every 4 or 5 years according to a certain pattern that iterates in a 2820-year cycle. A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.ToDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a DateTime that is set to the specified date and time in the specified era.
member.param: An integer that represents the year.
An integer that represents the month.
An integer that represents the day.
An integer that represents the hour.
An integer that represents the minute.
An integer that represents the second.
An integer that represents the millisecond.
An integer that represents the era.
member.returns: The DateTime instance set to the specified date and time in the current era.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.ToFourDigitYear(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts the specified two-digit year to a four-digit year by using the Globalization.PersianCalendar.TwoDigitYearMax property to determine the appropriate century.
member.param: A two-digit integer that represents the year to convert.
member.returns: An integer that contains the four-digit representation of year.
member.remarks: TwoDigitYearMax is the last year in the 100-year range that can be represented by a two-digit year. The century is determined by finding the sole occurrence of the two-digit year within that 100-year range. For example, if TwoDigitYearMax is set to 1429, the 100-year range is from 1330 to 1429; therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1330, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 1429.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.GetCentury(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the century of the specified DateTime.
member.param: An instance of the DateTime class to read.
member.returns: An integer from 1 to 94 that represents the century.
member.remarks: A century is a whole 100-year period. So the century 14 for example, represents years 1301 through 1400.

member.name: M:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.NumberOfLeapYearsUntil(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the number of leap years until -but not including- the specified year.
member.param: An integer between 1 and 9378
member.returns: An integer representing the number of leap years that have occured by the year specified.
member.remarks: In the Persian calendar leap years are applied every 4 or 5 years according to a certain pattern that iterates in a 2820-year cycle. A common year has 365 days and a leap year has 366 days.

member.name: P:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.Eras
member.summary: Gets the list of eras in the PersianCalendar.
member.remarks: The Persian calendar recognizes one era: A.P. (Latin "Anno Persarum", which means "the year of/for Persians").

member.name: P:System.Globalization.PersianCalendar.TwoDigitYearMax
member.summary: Gets and sets the last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.
member.property_value: The last year of a 100-year range that can be represented by a 2-digit year.
member.remarks: This property allows a 2-digit year to be properly translated to a 4-digit year. For example, if this property is set to 1429, the 100-year range is from 1330 to 1429; therefore, a 2-digit value of 30 is interpreted as 1330, while a 2-digit value of 29 is interpreted as 1429.

member.summary: Finds 1st day of the given year and month.
